demographics.diagnosis: Left plantar heel wound (Serial debridement, Alginate/Silver dressings)

case_header.outcome: Discharged to Home with HHA; Rapid Readmission to Hospital

clinical_logic.readiness_milestone: Wound healing and successful podiatry evaluation for serial debridement
clinical_barriers: Chronic non-healing left plantar heel wound
79-day SNF length of stay indicating slow healing
Potential arterial blood flow/vascular issues (noted in audit context)
Patient medically unstable post-discharge (readmitted following MD visit)

environmental_logic.physical_barriers: Arrangements at home (unspecified details, but required sister's confirmation)
environmental_logic.modification_type: N/A - Private home with sister acting as decision maker

timeline_deltas.context: SW updated PN that meeting occurred and date was moved up by two days with 48-hour notice.
Transition from PN Justine to PN Lyndsey created a period of 'confusion' and 'swapping' during the first weeks of October.

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Patient's sister requests higher frequency of care than Bayada provides.
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: PN scheduled supplemental home visit on an off-day (Tuesday or Thursday).
reasoning_trace_triples.result: Patient/Family satisfaction and service utilization established.

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: Physician calls PN with clinical questions and miscommunication of PN role.
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: PN escalated to Regional Director to handle MD communication.
reasoning_trace_triples.result: MD redirected; patient eventually sent back to hospital by MD.

reasoning_trace_triples.situation: PN excluded from discharge planning meetings.
reasoning_trace_triples.action_taken: Relied on SW updates; marked patient as 'imminent discharge' once informed.
reasoning_trace_triples.result: PN was 'blindsided' by 48-hour notice for the 10/11 discharge.

rank_1_best_practices.action: Coordinating a 4th visit on a day Bayada was not scheduled.
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: Directly addressed family anxiety and filled a gap in the standard care plan.

rank_1_best_practices.action: Justine (Original PN) provided comprehensive relay of data to Lyndsey.
rank_1_best_practices.rationale: Maintained continuity of care despite internal organizational chaos.

rank_0_boundary_failures.action: Assumed home environment was ready because SNF set the date.
Did not request to attend 'Weekly Utilization Review' or discharge planning.

unscripted_chaos_signals: Surprise physician phone call with 'bad information'
Decision-making incapacity (Sister acting as POA/decision maker)
